poem:
"Lost Journeys on a Channel Sea"

Oh wind-tossed sea,
Three brave, undone by a grave act.
Powers, you have claimed five, an innocent
bundled in the sum.
Pulled by desire, pushed by despair. 
Broken path to unknown land,
haunting the law's inflexible hand.
scarce angels in a crimson dawn.
The such lost, between Sudan's sands and England's rock,
In deep waters, dreams unwritten, rocked.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Three men arrested after five people die in Channel boat crossing Three men have been arrested in connection with a Channel boat crossing that led to the deaths of five people, including a young girl. The three have been arrested on suspicion of facilitating illegal immigration and entering the UK illegally. The suspects – two Sudanese men aged 22 and 19 and a 22-year-old from South Sudan – are being questioned by the National Crime". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
